name: Samarkand III: Cashmere and vintage japanese silk scarf
description:
SAMARKAND

We have been asked to make a lighter version of our scarves, for mild evenings or for those places around the world lucky enough to enjoy a more gentle weather.
Samarkand will keep you toastie thanks to its outer shell in cashmere and silk with just half the weight of a full cashmere scarf. It will also look dapper and stylish with its Japanese silk lining, our trademark.
It is a quality fabric with a luxurious sheen to it that will feel soft and light around your neck.
Just like our other scarves, these are made in a limited edition of 10 units worldwide, to ensure its exclusivity. This particular model shows an outer shell in black cashmere and silk with a lining in black and white minimalist designs.
This scarf has been handmade in Britain, from great fabrics. It measures 60x10" (150x25cm) and it feels as good as it looks. Give it a try.
It comes nicely gift wrapped, making a great present for a loved one or a wonderful treat for yourself.

name: Edo II: Cashmere and vintage japanese silk scarf
description:
EDO

This collection is made with outer shells of british woven cashmere and luxurious linings in vintage japanese silk.
We choose silks from the Showa period, originally intended for wedding kimonos and give them a twist applying them onto scarves and accessories. The result is striking. These are scarves for those who wish a very elegant accessory but still want to express some individuality.

This is a cashmere and silk scarf, 60x10" (150x25 cm), black outer with a red silk lining.

It comes in an elegant gift box, carefully wrapped. It makes an excellent present for a loved one or just a luxury treat for oneself.

Care tips:
Wool and silk are very lasting materials but at the same time require some attention and care. Store your scarves flat and if possible wrapped in tissue paper. This is a dry-clean only item.
